article.headline: Savannah St. 63, Texas A&amp,M-Corpus Christi 57
article.story: CORPUS CHRISTI, Texas -- Preston Blackmon and Stephen Wilson scored 16 points apiece and Savannah State defeated Texas A&M-Corpus Christi 63-57 in overtime on Monday night. Blackmon's basket with 6 seconds left in regulation tied the game at 54. Hollis Hill made a 3-pointer in the first minute of overtime for Texas A&M-Corpus Christi, but the Islanders didn't score again. Savannah State went ahead for good 58-57 on Jovonni Shuler's 3-pointer with 2:52 left in the extra period. Joshua Montgomery added a 3-pointer and Wilson made two free throws for the final margin -- the Tigers' largest of the game. Shuler scored 12 points for Savannah State (6-17), which has won four in a row. Justin Reynolds had 19 points and 15 rebounds for the Islanders (8-16), who saw a 12-point second-half lead slip away. Demond Watt had 18 points, nine rebounds and three blocked shots for the hosts.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
